text:
How to use
This lib provides a Card class you can use to create, display, and compare playing cards:

Card(1, 3)

3♦️


Suits are numbered according to this list:

suits

['♣️', '♦️', '♥️', '♠️']

title: card–A basic playing card
text:
Comparison operators
Equality, less than, and greater than work on the rank and suit indices:
For instance, here is a test of equality…

test_eq(Card(suit=1, rank=3), Card(suit=1, rank=3))

…and a test of <…

assert Card(suit=1, rank=3) < Card(suit=2, rank=3)

…and finally of >:

assert Card(suit=3, rank=3) > Card(suit=2, rank=3)
assert not Card(suit=1, rank=3) > Card(suit=2, rank=3)

Deck

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
When we initially create a deck, all of the cards will be present:

deck = Deck()

That should be 52 cards.

As a reminder, these are the suits we defined for a Card

suits

['♣️', '♦️', '♥️', '♠️']


We can check if, say, the Ace of Clubs is in the deck:
